content: 1 purl-wise p to end of row 32 stitches total repeat round 1 and round 2 a total of 16 times or 32 row total heel turn row 1 rs slip 1 purl-wise k18 ssk k1 turn work row 2 ws slip 1 purl-wise p7 p2tog p1 turn work row 3 rs slip 1 purl-wise knit to one stitch before gap ssk k1 turn work row 4 ws slip 1 purl-wise purl to 1 stitch before gap p2tog p1 turn work repeat row 3 and 4 until all stitches have been worked 20 stitches remain rs knit across all 20 stitches gusset pick up and knit 17 stitches along the edge of heel flap picking up 1 stitch per 2 row plus one extra stitch at the corner to prevent a hole at top of gusset place marker if using dpns this may not be necessary work in pattern starting with row 1 across top of foot place marker if using dpns this may not be necessary pick up and knit 17 stitches along the edge of heel flap picking up 1 stitch per 2 row plus one extra stitch at the starting corner to prevent a hole at top of gusset knit 10 stitches place new beginning-of-round bor marker round 1 knit until marker work in pattern across top of foot until marker knit to end of round round 2 knit to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 slip marker work in pattern across top of foot until marker slip marker k1 ssk knit to end 2 stitches decreased repeat round 1 and 2 a total of 11 times until there are a total of 64 stitches left foot shift bor marker to original spot at the side of the foot where the cast-on tail corresponds to continue working in pattern as established pattern across top of foot stockinette across bottom of foot until sock is 1 5 inches short of desired length toes round 1 knit round 2 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before end of round k2tog k1 4 stitches decreased repeat round 1 and 2 until 32 stitches remain a total of 8 times repeat round 2 until 24 stitches remain cut yarn leaving a 12-inch tail and use kitchener stitch to close the toes weave in ends repeat for another sock thank you so much for trying my pattern if you d like to share your work with me on instagram tag #fablesocks and @dotcardigan happy knitting
